dt: {bc}to change or twist the meaning or sound of

pt: At first the word {it}garble{/it} meant {ldquo}to sift{rdquo} or {ldquo}to sort or pick out.{rdquo} If you pick out a few misleading parts of a message and report only those parts, you distort the message, and so {it}garble{/it} came to mean {ldquo}to distort.{rdquo} It is the meaning {ldquo}sift,{rdquo} however, that reflects the origin of {it}garble.{/it} The English word {it}garble{/it} came from an old Italian verb {it}garbellare{/it} that meant {ldquo}to sift.{rdquo} This word came in turn from an Arabic word {it}gharbala{/it} that meant {ldquo}sieve.{rdquo} The Arabs took this word ultimately from a Latin word {it}cribellum{/it} that meant {ldquo}sieve.{rdquo}

shortdef: to change or twist the meaning or sound of
to change or twist the meaning or sound of
